abstract: Preface.- Acknowledgments.- Introduction.- I. Background.- Preliminaries.- Computability Theory.- Kolmogorov Complexity of Finite Strings.- Relating Plain and Prefix-Free Complexity.- Effective Reals.- II. Randomness of Sets.- Martin-Lof Randomness.- Other Notions of Effective Randomness.- Algorithmic Randomness and Turing Reducibility.- III. Relative Randomness.- Measures of Relative Randomness.- The Quantity of K- and Other Degrees.- Randomness-Theoretic Weakness.- Lowness for Other Randomness Notions.- Effective Hausdorff Dimension.- IV. Further Topics.- Omega as an Operator.- Complexity of C.E. Sets.- References.- Index.
